metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Insert Multiple Records Into MySQL Using MySQLi and PDO
Multiple SQL statements must be executed with the mysqli_multi_query() function.
content.html: Multiple SQL statements must be executed with the mysqli_multi_query() function.

content.text: The following examples add three new records to the "MyGuests" table:
content.html: The following examples add three new records to the "MyGuests" table:

content.code_html:
<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDB";

// Create connection
$conn = new mysqli($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
// Check connection
 if ($conn->connect_error) {
  die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);
}

$sql = "INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john@example.com');";
$sql .= "INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
VALUES ('Mary', 'Moe', 'mary@example.com');";
$sql .= "INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
VALUES ('Julie', 'Dooley', 'julie@example.com')";

if ($conn->multi_query($sql) === TRUE) {
  echo "New records created successfully";
} else {
  echo "Error: " . $sql . "<br>" . $conn->error;
}

$conn->close();
?>

content.text: Note that each SQL statement must be separated by a semicolon.
content.html: Note that each SQL statement must be separated by a semicolon.

content.code_html:
<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDB";

// Create connection
 $conn = mysqli_connect($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
// Check connection
 if (!$conn) {
  die("Connection failed: " . mysqli_connect_error());
}

$sql = "INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john@example.com');";
$sql .= "INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
VALUES ('Mary', 'Moe', 'mary@example.com');";
$sql .= "INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
VALUES ('Julie', 'Dooley', 'julie@example.com')";

if (mysqli_multi_query($conn, $sql)) {
  echo "New records created successfully";
} else {
  echo "Error: " . $sql . "<br>" . mysqli_error($conn);
}

mysqli_close($conn);
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text: " . mysqli_error($conn);}mysqli_close($conn); ?>

content.text: The PDO way is a little bit different:
content.html: The PDO way is a little bit different:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<?php$servername = "localhost";$username = "username";
 $password = "password";$dbname = "myDBPDO";try {
    $conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);
    // set the PDO error mode to exception  $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);
    // begin the transaction  $conn->beginTransaction();  // our SQL statements
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john@example.com')");
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Mary', 'Moe', 'mary@example.com')");
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Julie', 'Dooley', 'julie@example.com')");  // commit the transaction  $conn->commit();  echo "New records created successfully";
  } catch(PDOException $e) {  // roll back the transaction if something failed  $conn->rollback();
    echo "Error: " . $e->getMessage();}
 $conn = null;
?>
// set the PDO error mode to exception
// roll back the transaction if something failed

content.code:
<?php$servername = "localhost";$username = "username";
$password = "password";$dbname = "myDBPDO";try {
$conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);
// set the PDO error mode to exception  $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);
// begin the transaction  $conn->beginTransaction();  // our SQL statements
$conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john@example.com')");
$conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Mary', 'Moe', 'mary@example.com')");
$conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Julie', 'Dooley', 'julie@example.com')");  // commit the transaction  $conn->commit();  echo "New records created successfully";
} catch(PDOException $e) {  // roll back the transaction if something failed  $conn->rollback();
echo "Error: " . $e->getMessage();}
$conn = null;
?>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<?php$servername = "localhost";$username = "username";
 $password = "password";$dbname = "myDBPDO";try {
    $conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);
    // set the PDO error mode to exception  $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);
    // begin the transaction  $conn->beginTransaction();  // our SQL statements
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john@example.com')");
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Mary', 'Moe', 'mary@example.com')");
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Julie', 'Dooley', 'julie@example.com')");  // commit the transaction  $conn->commit();  echo "New records created successfully";
  } catch(PDOException $e) {  // roll back the transaction if something failed  $conn->rollback();
    echo "Error: " . $e->getMessage();}
 $conn = null;
?>
// set the PDO error mode to exception
// roll back the transaction if something failed

content.code_html:
<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDBPDO";

try {
  $conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);
  // set the PDO error mode to exception
  $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);

  // begin the transaction
  $conn->beginTransaction();
  // our SQL statements
   $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
  VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john@example.com')");
  $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
  VALUES ('Mary', 'Moe', 'mary@example.com')");
  $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)
  VALUES ('Julie', 'Dooley', 'julie@example.com')");

  // commit the transaction
  $conn->commit();
  echo "New records created successfully";
} catch(PDOException $e) {
  // roll back the transaction if something failed
  $conn->rollback();
  echo "Error: " . $e->getMessage();
}

$conn = null;
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<?php$servername = "localhost";$username = "username";
 $password = "password";$dbname = "myDBPDO";try {
    $conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);
    // set the PDO error mode to exception  $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);
    // begin the transaction  $conn->beginTransaction();  // our SQL statements
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john@example.com')");
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Mary', 'Moe', 'mary@example.com')");
    $conn->exec("INSERT INTO MyGuests (firstname, lastname, email)   VALUES ('Julie', 'Dooley', 'julie@example.com')");  // commit the transaction  $conn->commit();  echo "New records created successfully";
  } catch(PDOException $e) {  // roll back the transaction if something failed  $conn->rollback();
    echo "Error: " . $e->getMessage();}
 $conn = null;
?>
// set the PDO error mode to exception
// roll back the transaction if something failed
